newsitem.title: GREECE: BANK BROKERAGES WORKING ON AGREEMENT TO RESUME TRADE.
newsitem.headline: BANK BROKERAGES WORKING ON AGREEMENT TO RESUME TRADE.

text.p: Five bank brokerages had their terminals switched on at the floor of the exchange and were working on an agreement to go ahead and resume trade among themselves, a high level bank official told Reuters.

While some had entered some token bids and offers there was still no trade at the bourse. Trade among the five bank brokerages would resume only after an agreement between the banks was reached, the official said.

The five bank brokerages with trading terminals swithched on by the bourse were Alpha Brokerage of Alpha Credit Bank, Ergo Bank, Ionian Securities of Ionian Bank, Commercial Securities of Commercial Bank and National Securities of National Bank .
It was unclear which brokerage had entered bids or offers as reflected on Reuters screens.
